intro: Pilosella glaucescens subsp. megalomastix, commonly known as the glaucous pilosella, is a flowering plant in the Asteraceae family. It is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage that gives it a distinctive, mat-like appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its subsp. megalomastix is distinguished by its larger, more prominent flower heads compared to other subspecies.
